Operation 'delete-/crm/v3/pipelines/{objectType}/{pipelineId}_archive' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_side_effects, inconsistent_terminology. The operation uses DELETE method but the operation ID indicates 'archive' behavior. The description is too minimal and doesn't clarify the archival semantics (soft delete vs hard delete). Added clarification about archived pipeline behavior and return value. Changed summary to use 'archive' terminology consistent with the operation ID and API context.

data.description_suggestion: Archive the pipeline identified by `{pipelineId}`. Archived pipelines are soft-deleted and cannot be used for new objects, but existing objects remain associated with the archived pipeline. The operation returns no content on success.
data.reasoning: The operation uses DELETE method but the operation ID indicates 'archive' behavior. The description is too minimal and doesn't clarify the archival semantics (soft delete vs hard delete). Added clarification about archived pipeline behavior and return value. Changed summary to use 'archive' terminology consistent with the operation ID and API context.

message: Operation 'post-/crm/v3/pipelines/{objectType}/{pipelineId}/stages_create' has semantic quality issues: missing_context, missing_input_details. Original description lacks clarity about pipeline validation requirements (must be un-archived per API context) and input/output schema details. Added context about pipeline existence validation, explicit mention of input schema, and clarification that ID is generated. This helps AI agents understand prerequisites and what to expect.

data.current_description: Create a new stage associated with the pipeline identified by `{pipelineId}`. The entire stage object, including its unique ID, will be returned in the response.
data.description_suggestion: Create a new stage within the specified pipeline. Requires the pipeline to exist and be un-archived. Accepts a PipelineStageInput object with stage properties. Returns the complete stage object including the generated unique ID and timestamps.
data.reasoning: Original description lacks clarity about pipeline validation requirements (must be un-archived per API context) and input/output schema details. Added context about pipeline existence validation, explicit mention of input schema, and clarification that ID is generated. This helps AI agents understand prerequisites and what to expect.

message: Operation 'post-/crm/v3/pipelines/{objectType}_create' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_side_effects. Description lacks specificity about supported object types and what happens after creation. Added clarification that object type must be 'deals' or 'tickets' per API context, explicit schema reference, and information about the pipeline's active state post-creation to help AI agents understand the operation's effects.

data.current_description: Create a new pipeline with the provided property values. The entire pipeline object, including its unique ID, will be returned in the response.
data.description_suggestion: Create a new pipeline for the specified object type (deals or tickets). Accepts a PipelineInput object with pipeline properties. Returns the complete pipeline object including the generated unique ID. The new pipeline will be active and available for use immediately.
data.reasoning: Description lacks specificity about supported object types and what happens after creation. Added clarification that object type must be 'deals' or 'tickets' per API context, explicit schema reference, and information about the pipeline's active state post-creation to help AI agents understand the operation's effects.

message: Operation 'put-/crm/v3/pipelines/{objectType}/{pipelineId}/stages/{stageId}_replace' has semantic quality issues: missing_context, missing_input_details. Description lacks important context about pipeline validation requirements and clarification about what happens to unprovided properties in a full replacement operation. Added validation requirements per API context and explicit warning that this is a full replacement (not partial), which is critical for AI agents to avoid data loss.

data.current_description: Replace all the properties of an existing pipeline stage with the values provided. The updated stage will be returned in the response.
data.description_suggestion: Replace all properties of an existing pipeline stage with the provided values. Requires the pipeline to exist and be un-archived. Accepts a PipelineStageInput object. Any properties not explicitly provided will be reset to defaults. Returns the updated stage object.
data.reasoning: Description lacks important context about pipeline validation requirements and clarification about what happens to unprovided properties in a full replacement operation. Added validation requirements per API context and explicit warning that this is a full replacement (not partial), which is critical for AI agents to avoid data loss.

message: Operation 'delete-/crm/v3/pipelines/{objectType}/{pipelineId}/stages/{stageId}_archive' has semantic quality issues: inconsistent_terminology, missing_side_effects, not_actionable. Operation ID indicates 'archive' but summary/description say 'delete', creating terminology inconsistency. Per API context, pipelines support archiving. Description lacks clarity about the soft-delete nature, side effects on existing data, and response behavior. Updated terminology to 'archive' for consistency and added context about data retention and response expectations.

data.current_description: Delete the pipeline stage identified by `{stageId}` associated with the pipeline identified by `{pipelineId}`.
data.description_suggestion: Archive the pipeline stage identified by `{stageId}` within the specified pipeline. Archived stages are soft-deleted and hidden from active use but retain historical data. The stage must exist and the pipeline must be un-archived. No response body is returned on success.
data.reasoning: Operation ID indicates 'archive' but summary/description say 'delete', creating terminology inconsistency. Per API context, pipelines support archiving. Description lacks clarity about the soft-delete nature, side effects on existing data, and response behavior. Updated terminology to 'archive' for consistency and added context about data retention and response expectations.

message: Operation 'patch-/crm/v3/pipelines/{objectType}/{pipelineId}/stages/{stageId}_update' has semantic quality issues: missing_context. Description is mostly clear but lacks context about pipeline validation requirements (must exist and be un-archived per API context) and explicit schema reference. data.current_description: Perform a partial update of the pipeline stage identified by `{stageId}` associated with the pipeline identified by `{pipelineId}`. Any properties not included in this update will keep their existing values. The updated stage will be returned in the response.
data.description_suggestion: Perform a partial update of the pipeline stage identified by `{stageId}` within the specified pipeline. Requires the pipeline to exist and be un-archived. Accepts a PipelineStagePatchInput object. Only provided properties will be modified; unprovided properties retain their existing values. Returns the updated stage object.
data.reasoning: Description is mostly clear but lacks context about pipeline validation requirements (must exist and be un-archived per API context) and explicit schema reference. Added these details to help AI agents understand prerequisites and what input format is expected.
